page.title: 03FROGMORE
page.content: { Frogmore}is first heard of in 1513.It was at the western edge of the town bordering Hughenden Stream. It later developed into a business centre. In {1870,}a green was laid and a{fountain was installed. In{1843}the Art School was built there. In{1942}the fountain was dismantled and sold for scrap as part of the war effort.Several buildings of interest remain.The {Parker Knoll}furniture factory from the last century and{Gardener's furniture store.The{railway bridge, which was decorated with chairs when Queen Victoria visited here, on her way to Hughenden Manor,the home of Benjaman Disraeli,the Prime Minister. { Today,}plans have been proposed to turn Frogmore into a paved precinct with flower beds and a replica of the Victorian fountain.
